author: Laurens Weyn
text:
EDIT: turns out this was fake news spread by a translator, see other comments for clarification. Original comment:

People have been calling her pettan, saying peko etc etc just to get a reaction from her for a while now, but yesterday on top of that several asked her to stop streaming so they could watch another stream (holoEN debuts). That was too far and she got understandably sad

author: Joel
text: Oh ok and wym peko? I don’t understand that part and I mean it’s not fully her fault she just wanted to talk and chat with her fans what’s wrong about that? Like if they wanted to watch the en debut they could if they wanted to but I don’t think she should be getting hate for not ending her stream to go watch the en debuts

author: Joel
text: Was it the en viewers who were saying all of that or what?

author: IxNoiRxI
text: @Joel  Nope, those were mostly jp viewers. A video with translations of people "hating" on Rushia became pretty popular, so a lot of people went to support Rushia in this stream.

author: Nexcell Pride
text:
Everyone would know which behind Rushia is not only her Seiyuu (Voice Actress), also are 2 people more: the creator (Yasuyuki-sensei) and her Live2D modelers (First was Fumi and the second one was Tou-Irie), and they as all people, have heart and feelings despite we haven't same scheduling as Rushia's voice actress in most occasion.

Well... forgive me if I have a hard time interpreting certain words.

author: Recews
text: Tuvo un stream leyendo super chats y de la nada le empezaron a decir que dejara de stremear y que saliera porque el stream de hololiveEN estaba por comenzar ... Pero se lo dijieron de una forma no agradable y Rushia no sabia que hacer , al final termino su stream y se le veia frustrada. La hicieron sentir mal... Imaginate, envez de solo salirte del stream de Rushia y ver HololiveEN, pedirle que termine su stream por eso?? No se que les pasa a algunos la verdad.

author: Nexcell Pride
text:
@Recews  Argh... Esos son falsos fans... No valen la pena... Un verdadero fan sigue al o a la artista en ese caso en las buenas, en las malas y en las ni tanto.
La misión de ahora es mantener esa linda sonrisa... Nos encontramos a esta linda necromancer, muy talentosa y aparte con un excelente estilo de apariencia por conducto del maestro Yasuyuki.

author: Elmer Paz Leandro
text: Si fueron muy groseros no saben lo feo que fue verla tan triste por dicha en este stream todo cambió

author: Nexcell Pride
text: @Elmer Paz Leandro  Tal vez ella no tenga buena suerte, no sea tan buena en ciertos juegos, o incluso se enfade demasiado cuando las cosas andan mal... Su voz cantando es hermosa (Incluso también puede hacer ASMR de manera exitosa) y además cocina muy bien. Incluso demuestra sus emociones demasiado fácil, por lo que tiende a quebrarse fácilmente o emocionarse... Es demasiado sensible y por eso también nuestra misión es protegerla.

author: Elmer Paz Leandro
text: @Nexcell Pride  después de todo es una persona por lo general nosotros los humanos somos frágiles y tenemos que entender que no todo es Ahuevo ellas tienen sus horarios nosotros no tenemos el derecho de estarlas presionando pobre mi Rushia debió de haberse sentido muy mal

author: Nexcell Pride
text: @Elmer Paz Leandro  No sólo una persona detrás del personaje, sino tres: Su actriz de voz, también quien la diseñó y también quien le dio vida en su Live2D. (Creo que lo expliqué arriba)

author: gtf234
text: @Takeshi Mitsuhide  Honestly, they all should have mods at this point, it's the only way to put a stop to deliberately rude and disruptive viewers- let's not kid ourselves, asking them nicely doesn't make them comply and the report function isn't designed to be a substitute for moderation.  Hell, there were a few people who refused to stop shouting about the subject, declaring that they're being supportive even after being told to knock it off- so even those with 'good' intentions need an authoritative slap to the back of the head as well.
